verses.text: When Jethro , the priest of Midian , Moses’ father in law , heard of all that God had done for Moses , and for Israel his people , \add and\add* that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had brought Israel out of Egypt ;
Then Jethro , Moses’ father in law , took Zipporah , Moses’ wife , after he had sent her back ,
And her two sons ; of which the name of the one \add was\add* Gershom ; for he said , I have been an alien in a strange land :\f + \fr 18.3 \ft Gershom: that is A stranger there\f*

And the name of the other \add was\add* Eliezer ; for the God of my father , \add said he, was\add* mine help , and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh :\f + \fr 18.4 \ft Eliezer: that is, My God is an help\f*
And Jethro , Moses’ father in law , came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness , where he encamped at the mount of God :
And he said unto Moses , I thy father in law Jethro am come unto thee, and thy wife , and her two sons with her. \p

¶ And Moses went out to meet his father in law , and did obeisance , and kissed him; and they asked each other of \add their\add* welfare ; and they came into the tent.\f + \fr 18.7 \ft welfare: Heb. peace\f*

And Moses told his father in law all that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake , \add and\add* all the travail that had come upon them by the way , and \add how\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* delivered them.  +  r 18.8  t come…: Heb. found them *
And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had done to Israel , whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.

And Jethro said , Blessed \add be\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians , and out of the hand of Pharaoh , who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Now I know that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* greater than all gods : for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly \add he was\add* above them.
And Jethro , Moses’ father in law , took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God : and Aaron came , and all the elders of Israel , to eat bread with Moses’ father in law before God. \p
¶ And it came to pass on the morrow , that Moses sat to judge the people : and the people stood by Moses from the morning unto the evening.

And when Moses’ father in law saw all that he did to the people , he said , What \add is\add* this thing that thou doest to the people ? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even ?
And Moses said unto his father in law , Because the people come unto me to enquire of God :

When they have a matter , they come unto me; and I judge between one and another , and I do make \add them\add* know the statutes of God , and his laws.\f + \fr 18.16 \ft one…: Heb. a man and his fellow\f*
And Moses’ father in law said unto him, The thing that thou doest \add is\add* not good.

Thou wilt surely wear away , both thou, and this people that \add is\add* with thee: for this thing \add is\add* too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.\f + \fr 18.18 \ft Thou wilt…: Heb. Fading thou wilt fade\f*
Hearken now unto my voice , I will give thee counsel , and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward , that thou mayest bring the causes unto God :
And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws , and shalt shew them the way wherein they must walk , and the work that they must do.

Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men , such as fear God , men of truth , hating covetousness ; and place \add such\add* over them, \add to be\add* rulers of thousands , \add and\add* rulers of hundreds , rulers of fifties , and rulers of tens :

And let them judge the people at all seasons : and it shall be, \add that\add* every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge : so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear \add the burden\add* with thee.
If thou shalt do this thing , and God command thee \add so\add*, then thou shalt be able to endure , and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law , and did all that he had said.
And Moses chose able men out of all Israel , and made them heads over the people , rulers of thousands , rulers of hundreds , rulers of fifties , and rulers of tens.
And they judged the people at all seasons : the hard causes they brought unto Moses , but every small matter they judged themselves. \p
¶ And Moses let his father in law depart ; and he went his way into his own land.
